function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Reduced capacity and increased costs of implementing safety procedures may lead to inadequate conservation activities.","Impact":"Negative impact on native wildlife and biodiversity preservation.","Mitigation":"Invest in technology for remote monitoring and management of conservation sites, and provide training for staff to optimize use of resources.","Technologies":"Remote sensing technology, drones, and conservation management software.","People":"Conservation organizations, parks, and wildlife management agencies.","Owner":"Conservation organizations and environmental management authorities."},{"Description":"Less urgent tasks such as research projects and long-term monitoring are deprioritized during the pandemic, leading to gaps in data and understanding of conservation needs.","Impact":"Decreased understanding of ecological patterns, species behavior, and habitat changes, resulting in ineffective conservation planning.","Mitigation":"Collaborate with research institutions to prioritize and fund essential long-term monitoring and data collection, and implement remote data collection techniques.","Technologies":"Remote monitoring devices, environmental sensors, and data analytics software.","People":"Conservation researchers, wildlife biologists, and environmental data analysts.","Owner":"Research institutions, conservation organizations, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Utilization of militarized conservation methods post-pandemic may have severe societal and psychological repercussions, particularly for communities previously traumatized by war.","Impact":"Negative effects on community well-being, trust in conservation efforts, and social stability.","Mitigation":"Engage with local communities to understand their concerns and needs, and invest in community-led conservation approaches that prioritize empowerment and collaboration.","Technologies":"Community engagement platforms, participatory mapping tools, and social impact assessment software.","People":"Local communities, conservation organizations, and governmental bodies.","Owner":"Conservation organizations and government agencies."}]}
